intro: Chamaesyce jonesii, commonly known as Jones' sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, green, lobed leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Chamaesyce jonesii is an herbaceous perennial that is well adapted to drought conditions.
